poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Laws are losers. Brewster monks
Re-route their loins for lauds in the night.
One logs in, nods off. He longs
For bed. Would that be lux or sloth?
Who'd be a man of the cloth? The primate!
Lolls and lords it. Lobs his jug
Owre the chapterhouse roof at tonsured lawns.
